title.narrative: Ta'zeez - Independent Monitoring for DFID in Yemen Programme

description.narrative: DFID Yemen team; DFID cooperating partners

Independent verification that DFID-funded projects are being delivered; views and voices collected from the beneficiary communities; lesson learning to improve DFID and cooperating partner programming. Intended outcome is that DFID programmes more appropriately meet the needs on the ground. The intended impact is better performance of UK investment in Yemen. The main assumption is that DFID staff and partners will use the information to improve programme design.

Ta’zeez (meaning ‘strengthening’ in Arabic) provides independent third party monitoring of Department for International Development's (DFID's) programme in Yemen and is managed by British Council in partnership with Interaction In Development, a Yemeni research and development consultancy, and ITAD Ltd, a UK consultancy specialising in monitoring and evaluation. Ta’zeez provides verification in the field of humanitarian aid results reported to DFID by their cooperating partners. This provides independent assurance of value for money and accountability for the UK government, tax payers and stakeholders that DFID’s development investment reaches intended beneficiaries and is used to best effect. It also provides information from project beneficiaries which feeds into DFID programme design and monitoring evaluation. This was a three-year project extended to four years.
